oai_dc:dc.dc:title: STABILITY PREDICTION ON ARMOR BLOCKS FOR SUBMERGED BREAKWATER BY COMPUTATIONAL FLUID DYNAMICS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Matsumoto, Akira
Mano, Akira
Mistui, Jun
Hanzawa, Minoru
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave force
Morison formula
numerical wave flume
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An evaluation model of the critical condition on armor block stability for submerged breakwaters was proposed by the author before (2011). However, the effect of the force normal to the block was not included in the model. Moreover, the drag and inertia coefficients were set to 1.0 as tentative values. In this study, the proposed model is improved by the inclusion of the wave force in the normal direction and the use of the fluid force coefficients determined by a 3D numerical computation.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 33 (2012): Proceedings of 33rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Santander, Spain, 2012; structures.23
